Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Horine (WW304; Trp-rich; Arg-rich; synthetic AMPs20; BBmM; UCLL1c; XXA; Parent: WW291; TetraF4W-RK)
Sequence Information.Source: computer designed based on database, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (40%) toTritrpticinW: 50%; R: 38%; L:13%. Mol. Wt: 1344.591; GRAVY: -1.66; Mol. ex. coeff.: 22200.Activity: Active against E. faecium V286-17 (VRE) (MIC 2 uM), S. aureus USA300 LAC MRSA and 30 clinical strains (MIC 2-8 uM), K-pneumoniae E406-17 (MIC >32 uM),  A. baumannii B28-16 (MIC 32 uM), P-aeruginosa E411-17 (MIC >32 uM), and E. coli E423-17 (MIC 16-32 uM). It is primarily active against Gram+ pathogens, inlcuding 32 S. aureus clinical strains (MIC50 4 uM). It killed most of MRSA in the 48 h preformed biofilms at 2-4 MIC.Structure: The 3D NMR structure of TetraF2W-RK (parent of horine) bound to membrane-mimetic micelles DPC has been determined by the improved 2D NMR method. The peptide forms the shortest 2-turn amphipathic helix.You can rotate, zoom, and view the structureherein the PDB.MOA:bacteria: it permeabilized S. aureus membranes (also D=L).Resistance development:no:bacteria:S. aureus: S. aureus USA300 LAC did not develop resistance to horine during a multiple passage experiment.SAR: A triple WWW motif at the N-terminus is essential for membrane targeting and killing of MRSA in biofilms (Zarena et al., 2017).In vitro toxicity: very low hemol.lytic hRBC (HC50 >200 uM), other cytotoxicity: human hepatic progenitor liver cell (HepaRG (LC50 >80 uM), human kidney HEK293 (LC50 >100 uM), human lung fibroblasts (MRC9) (LC50>35 uM), and mouse splenocytes (LC50 >50 uM).Half-life in vitro:plasma:human:  half life is 15 min.In vivo PK:mice:  IV blood plasma half life is less than 15 min. However, d-horine, made of D-amino acids, has a half life of up to 1 h.In vivo toxicity:mice:  horine did not display toxic effects to kidney (nephrotoxicity) after one week of daily injection to mice or In vivo toxicity:rats.Animal model:mouse: neutropenic model: horine showed systemic efficacy in mice when administered either intraperitoneally (i.p.) or intravenously (i.v.) against MRSA infection.Surface immobilized peptide:TBA.Entry history: The original TetraF4W-RK has been replaced by the advanced version.Updated 7/2020; 7/2021; 6/2022; 11/2023; 11/2024; 4/2025
Literature Information.Author: Lakshmaiah Narayana J, Mishra B, Lushnikova T, Wu Q, Chhonker YS, Zhang Y, Zarena D, Salnikov ES, Dang X, Wang F, Murphy C, Foster KW, Gorantla S, Bechinger B, Murry DJ, Wang G. 2020
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2020 Aug 11;117(32):19446-19454. doi: 10.1073/pnas.2005540117. Epub 2020 Jul 28.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Two distinct amphipathic peptide antibiotics with systemic efficacy.
